body: This is a similar bug as #1028 . Change to the wrong class name when move into apache. Please send a pull request to fix it. J should before edis.

@candyleer Is already done? Or need further works?

> [Source code project](https://github.com/{Account ID}/{forked project name from incubator-skywalking})

Forked project name is normally as same as ours. So, we can use the same name in default.

> Test toolkit

Test toolkit should be provided as a public image, just download and use.

> Docker compose

Because only two files are required, no need to create so many repositories in our org. I prefer use different folders. In pr, contributor can choose to use our provided docker-compose to test their bug-fix or feature, or they can provided one in our `docker-compose`-fork repo. 

After `docker-compose` review, tested, passed, merged, the pr can be merged finally. In that cases, we have more test vessels for support different scenario.

Finally, we can use some ci env to run all cases(docker-compose) for full check, before release, or test in some check point.
@wu-sheng  already done,it's worked
@peng-yongsheng Please review this.

Sorry, but the KEYS, sigs and hashes URLs must not use dist.apache.org. That host is not intended for public use; it is only for ASF developers when staging releases.

As per the next section on the same page:
http://www.apache.org/dev/release-distribution#download-links

"All links to checksums, detached signatures and public keys MUST reference www.apache.org/dist/ using https:// (TLS)."

For example:

https://www.apache.org/dist/incubator/skywalking/5.0.0-alpha/KEYS

Also the KEYS file must contain the keys for all releases, so it should be in the parent directory, i.e.

https://www.apache.org/dist/incubator/skywalking/KEYS
@sebbASF Any example about the standard copyright footer?
This is a question for your mentors

Following adjustments done.

- URLs of  KEYS, sigs and hashes URLs target to `https://www.apache.org/dist/incubator/skywalking/****`

@peng-yongsheng This pr includes in a new dependency, https://github.com/searchbox-io/Jest, please be attention.

@wu-sheng, the text in the DISCLAIMER file you have in git should also be on the website, more info at https://incubator.apache.org/guides/branding.html#disclaimers

And under that text should be a copyright statement. something like:
```
Copyright © 2018, The Apache Software Foundation
Apache SkyWalking, SkyWalking, Apache, the Apache feather, and the Apache SkyWalking project logo are either registered trademarks or trademarks of the Apache Software Foundation. 
```

This would go on the bottom where you currently have `© 2018 Apache SkyWalking (incubating)`, replacing it with the disclaimer and the longer copyright sentence.

There's also more info at https://www.apache.org/foundation/marks/pmcs
The website updated.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/16396654/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/16396654)

Coverage remained the same at 19.528% when pulling **eb0e2619f9b373598a8909abf20e08053de2770e on peng-yongsheng-patch-1** into **4d7192f64c394901d97959bffac25c22dd19ed74 on master**.

## Report digest
```
metric name: /persistence, avg: 372859, rate: 0, calls: 100039, total: 37(s)
metric name: /segment/parse, avg: 274427, rate: 0, calls: 56000, total: 15(s)
metric name: /persistence/get, avg: 2828750, rate: 0, calls: 4464, total: 12(s)
```
Those points could be a source of performance bottlenecks.

## Performance optimization
### Segment parse
#### Change cache component from Guava to Caffeine, [ Caffeine's Benchmarks](https://github.com/ben-manes/caffeine/wiki/Benchmarks#read-100)
```
metric name: /persistence, avg: 194719, rate: 0, calls: 98341, total: 19(s)
metric name: /segment/parse, avg: 260367, rate: 0, calls: 56624, total: 14(s)
metric name: /persistence/get, avg: 1587150, rate: 0, calls: 4032, total: 6(s)
```
#### Make all the loggers class variable to have the static modifier.
```
Before:
/segment/parse
	Avg=636584 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=14000, Total=8912189125 (nanosecond)

After:
/segment/parse
	Avg=524138 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=14097, Total=7388775602 (nanosecond)
```

#### Time stamp format to time bucket performance optimization.
```
Before:
/segment/parse
	Avg=557410 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=14139, Total=7881231734 (nanosecond)
/utils/timeBucket/getSecondTimeBucket
	Avg=9768 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=17417, Total=170135908 (nanosecond)
/utils/timeBucket/getMinuteTimeBucket
	Avg=7384 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=82536, Total=609514865 (nanosecond)

After:
/segment/parse
	Avg=503868 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=14085, Total=7096993057 (nanosecond)
/utils/timeBucket/getSecondTimeBucket
	Avg=13636 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=3664, Total=49964432 (nanosecond)
/utils/timeBucket/getMinuteTimeBucket
	Avg=6148 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=27512, Total=169161105 (nanosecond)
```

#### Instance of and time bucket transform
1. Add contains point method instead instance of for decide span listener class type.
1. Transform minute time bucket just once.

```
Before:
/segment/parse
	Avg=503868 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=14085, Total=7096993057 (nanosecond)
After:
/segment/parse
	Avg=81916 (nanosecond), Success Rate=100%, Calls=455534, Total=37315774880 (nanosecond)
```

### Storage
#### Short Column Name and fixed a persistence timer bug
TPS before: 6k,   after: 10k

I think I got the point. Please, give me the service_name index information. I guess this index is incorrect.
I want know all the column data types in service_name index.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8957424/38466295-ab5c8436-3b59-11e8-90ac-bd9422fb1b8c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8957424/38466298-c42a8b7a-3b59-11e8-8650-c19f3a78b09d.png)

Got it.  This index is incorrect.  The column named service_name_keyword type is string. But it should actually to be keyword. So, could not find the registered record by termQuery method. This method just work good by keyword type.

This problem cause of you use 3.2.6 version before, then you upgrade to 5.0.0-alpha but not recreate index. When service name registered, the es will create this column by default type string.
@peng-yongsheng could you write a faq to talk about upgrade? This is a common, but hard to find issue.
i will clean 3.2.6 version data in Elasticsearch and  try again.

@50168383 Stop ES -> Delete the folder named data in ES -> Restart ES
@50168383 Notice, Restart all applications monitor by agent when you clean ES data.

thanks all friends.

He work well today. 
     this issuer is resolved。

reason:
     This problem cause of you use 3.2.6 version before, then you upgrade to 5.0.0-alpha but not recreate index. When service name registered, the es will create this column by default type string.

do:
    Restart all applications monitor by agent when you clean ES data.

Create a new file named `Upgrade.md`, describe all the upgrade FAQ in this file. Create a new section with the title of our project version and use subsection to separate UI, agent, collector when this version have some notices about upgrading.

As we already did before, I suggest after 5.0.0-RC, we can work on this based on following processes.
1. Design UI (prototype draft)
1. Design downstream protocol
1. Agent: Support dynamic enhance/unenhance, and metrics collect and report
1. Collector: Aggregation
1. Visualization in real UI implementation.

But in our grpc products, we  have found  that we used thread local in a wrong way.  

[grpc cross thread.pdf](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/files/1892337/grpc.cross.thread.pdf)

But, I have to say, auto instrumentation agent is hard to find out this situation.
